critique:
The document aims to convey a sense of decisive action and resolve in ensuring the continued production of war materials. The primary emotions the President wants to elicit are likely a sense of security (that the war effort will not be hampered) and perhaps a degree of surprise at the swiftness of the action. There might also be a desire to instill a bit of fear in those who might consider disrupting war production. The language is formal and authoritative, reinforcing these emotions. The initial scores are based on this analysis.

Revised scores:
- Joy: 1 (not a goal of the document)
- Sadness: 1 (not a goal of the document)
- Anger: 3 (a slight undercurrent towards those disrupting production)
- Fear: 4 (a moderate level directed at potential disruptors)
- Disgust: 2 (a mild level towards the labor disturbance)
- Surprise: 3 (a moderate level at the swiftness of the action)
